text: HLA-DR - , <extra_id_0> CD33 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - myeloid / natural killer cell acute leukemia : a previously unrecognized form of acute leukemia potentially misdiagnosed as French-American-British acute myeloid leukemia-M3 [ see comments ]
We have identified and characterized a previously unrecognized form of acute leukemia that shares features of both myeloid and natural killer ( NK ) cells .

From a consecutive series of 350 cases of adult de novo acute myeloid leukemia ( AML ) , we identified 20 cases ( 6 % ) with a unique immunophenotype : <extra_id_0> CD33 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD11a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD13lo <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD15lo <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / - , HLA-DR - , <extra_id_0> CD16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - .

Multicolor flow cytometric assays confirmed the coexpression of myeloid ( <extra_id_0> CD33 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD13 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD15 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and NK cell - associated ( <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) antigens in each case , whereas reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction ( RT-PCR ) assays confirmed the identity of <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( neural cell adhesion molecule ) in leukemic blasts .

Although two cases expressed <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , no case expressed <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , CD3 , or <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and no case showed clonal rearrangement of genes encoding the T-cell receptor ( <extra_id_0> TCR beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Leukemic blasts in the majority of cases shared unique morphologic features ( deeply invaginated nuclear membranes , scant cytoplasm with fine azurophilic granularity , and finely granular Sudan black B and <extra_id_0> myeloperoxidase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cytochemical reactivity ) that were remarkably similar to those of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( APL ) ; particularly the microgranular variant ( FAB AML-M3v ) .

However , all 20 cases lacked the t ( 15 ; 17 ) and 17 cases tested lacked the <extra_id_0> promyelocytic/retinoic acid receptor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) fusion transcript in RT-PCR assays ; 12 cases had 46 , XX or 46 , XY karyotypes , whereas 2 cases had abnormalities of chromosome 17q : 1 with del ( 17 ) ( q25 ) and the other with t ( 11 ; 17 ) ( q23 ; q21 ) and the <extra_id_0> promyelocytic leukemia zinc finger <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusion transcript .

All cases tested ( 6 / 20 ) , including the case with t ( 11 ; 17 ) , failed to differentiate in vitro in response to all-trans retinoic acid ( ATRA ) , suggesting that these cases may account for some APLs that have not shown a clinical response to ATRA .

Four of 6 cases tested showed functional NK cell - mediated cytotoxicity , suggesting a relationship between these unique <extra_id_0> CD33 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - acute leukemias and normal <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - NK precursor cells .

Using a combination of panning and multiparameter flow cytometric sorting , we identified a normal <extra_id_0> CD56 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD33 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - counterpart cell at a frequency of 1 % to 2 % in the peripheral blood of healthy individuals .

Our studies suggest that this form of acute leukemia may arise from transformation of a precursor cell common to both the myeloid and NK cell lineages ; thus we propose the designation myeloid / NK acute leukemia .
Recognition of this new leukemic entity will be important in distinguishing these ATRA - nonresponsive cases from ATRA - responsive true APL .
